feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a payroll system feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It calculates the daily pay rate by dividing an employee's total salary (basic salary plus allowances) by the number of actual working days in the month, accounting for public holidays and the organization's leave policy (calendar days or working days). Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system automatically generates and reflects the corresponding pay deduction on the payroll table. This feature ensures accurate and consistent salary calculations across the organization's leave management processes.

source_articles_index.title: How is daily pay calculated
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how daily pay is calculated for unpaid leave deductions. It defines the daily pay formula as Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by the number of actual working days in the month. The article clarifies that the number of days can be either calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) based on the organization's leave policy, and that public holidays must be deducted from working days to arrive at the actual working days used in the calculation. It provides an example showing how 2 public holidays reduce 22 working days to 20 actual working days for the daily pay calculation.

source_articles_index.title: Introduction to daily wage calculator
source_articles_index.article_summary: Introduces the Daily Wage Calculator feature, explaining its purpose, three calculation bases (calendar days, working days, custom days), salary component options, and its impact on salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions. Describes the distinction between calculation methods and highlights regional labor law compliance for UAE and KSA companies.

source_articles_index.title: Salary Proration
source_articles_index.article_summary: This article explains how to update salary proration settings in the Daily Wage Calculator (DWC). It describes the purpose of salary proration (affecting first salary and end-of-service settlements), the navigation path (Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation), the three available calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, working days), and the critical workflow for managing proration changes when payroll months are open with existing transactions. The article emphasizes that changes apply to all active unpaid payroll amounts and requires Super admin role access.

job_to_be_done.statement: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of actual working days or calendar days in the month, accounting for public holidays.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control and regional compliance.

Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement by selecting appropriate calculation bases (custom days, calendar days, or working days).

data_inputs_required.input: Employee's total salary amount ; Number of actual working days or calendar days in the month ; Public holidays occurring in the month
data_inputs_required.details: Comprises basic salary plus allowances, used as the numerator in the daily pay calculation formula. ; Determined by the organization's leave policy; used as the denominator in the daily pay calculation formula. ; Public holidays are deducted from the working days count to arrive at the actual working days for calculation purposes.

data_inputs_required.input: Calculation base selection ; Salary components to include
data_inputs_required.details: User must select one of three calculation bases: calendar days (total days in month), working days (business days only, excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined number of days, typically 30 for UAE/KSA compliance). ; User must choose which salary components to factor into calculations: basic salary only, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only.
Super admin must select one of three calculation bases: custom days, calendar days, or working days to determine how salary proration is calculated.

outputs_results.output: Automatic pay deduction amount ; Daily pay rate
outputs_results.details: The calculated daily pay rate multiplied by the number of unpaid leave days, automatically created and reflected on the payroll table upon approval of the unpaid leave request. ; The result of dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month, used to determine the deduction amount.

System generates daily wage rates that are applied to three main areas: salary proration (prorated salary calculations), leave encashment (payment for unused leave), and unpaid leave deduction (deductions for unpaid leave taken).
Proportionally adjusted employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table.

procedures.procedure_name: Calculate Daily Pay for Unpaid Leave Deduction
procedures.when_to_use: When an unpaid leave request has been approved and a pay deduction needs to be calculated and reflected in the payroll system.
steps: Receive and approve the unpaid leave request
Determine the organization's leave policy (calendar days or working days)
Identify the total number of days in the leave policy (e.g., 22 working days or 30 calendar days)
Identify all public holidays falling in the month for which daily pay is being calculated
Subtract the number of public holidays from the total working days to arrive at actual working days
Calculate daily pay using the formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) / Actual Working Days
Automatically generate and reflect the pay deduction on the payroll table

procedures.when_to_use: When setting up or modifying daily wage calculation methodology for the organization.
steps: Navigate to Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation
Select the calculation base: calendar days, working days, or custom days
Choose salary components to include in the calculation (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only)
System applies the selected calculation method to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions

procedures.when_to_use: When organization needs to change how employee salaries are prorated based on days worked, or to adjust calculation methodology for first salaries and end-of-service settlements.
steps: Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation
Select the desired calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days
If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions first, then save the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.rule: Daily pay is calculated by dividing the total salary amount (basic salary plus allowances) by the number of actual working days in the month. ; The leave policy determines whether calculations use calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) as the basis. ; Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to determine the actual working days used in the daily pay calculation. ; Pay deductions are only created and reflected on the payroll table upon approval of an unpaid leave request; they are generated automatically.

Calendar days calculation uses the actual number of days in each month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects monthly wage calculations. ; Working days calculation automatically excludes weekends and public holidays as configured in the company's public holiday calendar. ; Custom days calculation base allows flexibility for company-specific policies; most UAE and KSA companies set custom days to 30 to comply with regional labor law requirements. ; Only Superadmin, Payroll table managers, or transaction processors can select and modify the calculation base for daily wages.

Changes to salary proration settings will have an effect on all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table immediately upon saving. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must reject the transactions with prorated salaries before saving new proration settings changes.

edge_cases_warnings.edge_case_or_warning: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working days count; failure to do so will result in incorrect daily pay calculations. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the actual working days should be 20, not 22. ; The leave policy type (calendar days vs. working days) significantly impacts the daily pay calculation; ensure the correct policy is applied before calculating.

Calculation results vary significantly depending on the month length when using calendar days; February has fewer days than other months, which impacts daily wage calculations. ; Different calculation methods (calendar, working, or custom days) can produce substantially different final wage amounts for the same salary components; selection must align with company policy and regional labor law. ; Working days calculation depends on accurate public holiday calendar configuration; missing or incorrect public holidays will result in incorrect daily wage calculations.

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions have already been submitted for one or multiple employees, the Super admin must manually reject those transactions and then resave the new salary proration changes to avoid conflicts or incorrect calculations.

feature_interactions_dependencies.interaction: The daily wage calculator integrates with the leave management system to receive approved unpaid leave requests and with the payroll system to automatically generate and reflect pay deductions on the payroll table. ; The feature depends on the employee record system to retrieve employee salary information (basic salary and allowances) and the calendar system to identify public holidays.

Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three interconnected payroll areas: salary proration calculations, leave encashment payments, and unpaid leave deductions. ; Feature depends on the company's public holiday calendar configuration to accurately calculate working days and exclude non-business days from wage calculations.
Daily Wage Calculator interacts with the Payroll system and directly affects active payroll table transactions; changes to proration settings cascade to all unpaid payroll amounts.
